description.narrative: Strengthening socio-economic resilience of PWDs during COVID-19 crisis and beyond by enhancing accessibility of rehabilitation services with the focus on scaling-up vocational rehabilitation and promoting a barrier-free workplace environment

sector.narrative: Eradicate poverty in all its forms and dimensions

condition.narrative: UNDP as the Implementing Partner will comply with the policies, procedures and practices of the United Nations Security Management System (UNSMS.)

description.narrative:
2.1a Analytical note on the labor potential of people with disabilities (its volume, qualitative characteristics) and assessment of the conditions for the realization of their labor potential developed. 2.1.1a Number of PWDs, employers, medical and social workers participated in the assessment of PWDs’ needs in rehabilitation services, including vocational rehabilitation, and favorable working conditions
2.2a Number of pilots with accessible vocational rehabilitation services and barrier-free workplace environment for PWDs 2.2.1a Number of employment centers equipped with essential tools and devices to scale-up vocational rehabilitation of PWDs in accordance with methodological recommendations developed 2.2.1b Number of PWDs participated in the capacity assessment to examine the availability of PWDs-sensitive working conditions and barrier-free environment elements 2.2.1c Number of employer organizations equipped with tools, devices, and essential equipment to create PWDs-sensitive working conditions, and an accessible and barrier-free workplace environment for PWDs

comment.narrative:
2.1a Analytical note on the labor potential of people with disabilities (its volume, qualitative characteristics) and assessment of the conditions for the realization of their labor potential developed - 0 2.1.1a Number of PWDs, employers, medical and social workers participated in the assessment of PWDs’ needs in rehabilitation services, including vocational rehabilitation, and favorable working conditions - No comprehensive assessment of PWDs’ needs in rehabilitation conducted
2.2a Number of pilots with accessible vocational rehabilitation services and barrier-free workplace environment for PWDs - 0 2.2.1a Number of employment centers equipped with essential tools and devices to scale-up vocational rehabilitation of PWDs in accordance with methodological recommendations developed - 0 2.2.1b Number of PWDs participated in the capacity assessment to examine the availability of PWDs-sensitive working conditions and barrier-free environment elements - No comprehensive assessment conducted 2.2.1c Number of employer organizations equipped with tools, devices, and essential equipment to create PWDs-sensitive working conditions, and an accessible and barrier-free workplace environment for PWDs - 0

2.1.1a Number of PWDs, employers, medical and social workers participated in the assessment of PWDs’ needs in rehabilitation services, including vocational rehabilitation, and favorable working conditions - 1,500 PWDs, employers, medical and social workers 2.2.1b Number of PWDs participated in the capacity assessment to examine the availability of PWDs-sensitive working conditions and barrier-free environment elements - 2
